net.roydesign.app
Class Application

java.lang.Object
  net.roydesign.app.Application

public class Application
extends java.lang.Object

This is a wrapper for an application instance. It provides a unified API to the different mechanisms used by different platforms to handle menu items provided by the OS as well as some interapplication messages. The About, Preferences and Quit menu items are managed by this class, so that your application doesn't have to go into ugly if/else statements to add proper support for Mac OS platforms. The application messages also managed by this API are Open Application, Open Document and Print Document. See the ApplicationEvent class for more details as to the meaning of these messages.

To use this class, simply subclass it or use the Application.getInstance() method. Once you have an application instance, you can get a reference to the About, Preferences or Quit menu item and add event handling just as you normally would with any other menu item. Both Swing and AWT menus are supported. See the MenuItem or JMenuItem subclasses starting with About*, Preferences* or Quit* for more detailed information.

Note that since the About, Preferences and Quit menu items are provided by the OS in some cases and not in others, each MenuItem or JMenuItem subclass includes an isAutomaticallyPresent() method to allow clean cross-platform development.

To handle application messages, simply implement the ActionListener interface and attach your implementation to your application instance with the appropriate add***Listener() method. When the action listener is called, the event received can be cast to an ApplicationEvent to retrieve more information about the event, including the file object associated with it, if any.

Version:
MRJ Adapter 1.2
See Also:
AboutJMenuItem, AboutMenuItem, PreferencesJMenuItem, PreferencesMenuItem, QuitJMenuItem, QuitMenuItem, ApplicationEvent

Constructor Detail

Application

protected Application()
Construct an application instance. Note that only one can ever be created. Attempting to instantiate more will result in an IllegalStateException being thrown.

setFramelessMenuBar

public void setFramelessMenuBar(java.awt.MenuBar menuBar)
Set the AWT frameless menu bar of the application. This menu bar is shown when no frame is visible, which is a normal state for a Mac application. This method has no visible effect on other platforms.

Parameters:
menuBar - the AWT menu bar to use
See Also:
MRJAdapter.setFramelessMenuBar(java.awt.MenuBar)
